summary: Welcome to MCUREWRITE, a blog dedicated to fandom content creators and fans. We are a centralized location for creators to...
body:
Welcome to MCUREWRITE, a blog dedicated to fandom content creators and fans. We are a centralized location for creators to interact with viewers and to display their work. Here you can stay updated with the latest fan content in the Marvel Cinematic Universe! We track the tag #mcurewrite.

We’re currently looking for members and affiliates, so please reblog this post to help spread the word! You can also apply here. We’d love to have you as part of the team!

summary: Box Office Usa - Oltre 85 milioni per Aladdin nel weekend d'esordio
title: Box Office Usa - Oltre 85 milioni per Aladdin nel weekend d'esordio
body:
Box Office Usa – Oltre 85 milioni per Aladdin nel weekend d’esordio

La Disney ha piazzato un altro successo nella bacheca dei propri prodotti. Dopo Avengers: Endgame, anche Aladdin ha regalato un exploit da urlo nel Box Office Usa.

Nel weekend d’esordio Aladdin ha intascato 86,1 milioni di dollari, con una media per sala appena sotto i 20 mila dollari. Le stime degli analisti piazzavano il fantasy Disney tra i 75 e gli 85 milioni di dollari nei quattro giorni…

View On WordPress

disclaimer: I actually liked about 12% of it

about me // main // tag list

tags: as we all know theres a difference between stans and STANS™️
also anon if you have any additional edits send another ask
summary: endgame stans: but steve is HAPPY and he deserves to REST. me: yes he does but probably not at the cost of his character and...
question: endgame stans: but steve is HAPPY and he deserves to REST. me: yes he does but probably not at the cost of his character and peggy’s character?? stans: hE dEsErVeS tO rEsT. me: u cant tell me that he would be happy just sitting there not being able to help anyone, and being without his friends from the 21st century who should mean a lot to him and leaving them would hurt him?? is that a good rest? stans: HE DESERVES TO BE HAPPY. me: no one’s denying that?? but that wasnt a true Happy Ending??
answer:
i edited this on ur behalf anon:

endgame stans™️: but steve is HAPPY and he deserves to REST.

me, a stan who knows bad writing when i see it: yes he does but probably not at the cost of his character and peggy’s character??

stans™️: hE dEsErVeS tO rEsT.

me, again: u cant tell me that he would be happy just sitting there not being able to help anyone, and being without his friends from the 21st century who should mean a lot to him and leaving them would hurt him?? is that a good rest?

stans™️: HE DESERVES TO BE HAPPY.

me, again: no one’s denying that?? but that wasnt a true Happy Ending??

me, again: u cant tell me that he would be happy just sitting there not being able to help anyone, and being without his friends from the 21st century who should mean a lot to him and leaving them would hurt him?? is that a good rest?

stans™️: HE DESERVES TO BE HAPPY.

me, again: no one’s denying that?? but that wasnt a true Happy Ending??

me, a stan who knows bad writing when i see it: yes he does but probably not at the cost of his character and peggy’s character??

summary: I love how Marvel is telling me that the only way to be happy is to be white, to be in a heterosexual marriage with children, to...
question: I love how Marvel is telling me that the only way to be happy is to be white, to be in a heterosexual marriage with children, to live in a house with a white picket fence, the Christian family ideal, all while the wife is seen to be a prize and a reward, and that’s Stability and Happiness and what every person should strive for, and if you’re none of these, you should fuck off a cliff and die. Thanks Marvel, that really helps my self esteem as I am none of these things and want none of these.
answer: okay i know that this blog is like 90% satire but i legit am sorry and want you to know that my rant corner (and messages) are always open to you and anyone else who is going through it after this mess of a movie

summary: The LGBTQ+ rep in Avengers: Endgame
body:
The LGBTQ+ rep in Avengers: Endgame

was not meant to be representation.

The whole scene was a guy(played by one of the directors) talking about how he is currently dating another man(explicit use of he/him pronouns here.)

It wasn’t meant to be representation.

It was a message from Marvel telling us that “We see you. We acknowledge you. We’re so sorry it took us this long. But, we’re working on it.”

It may not be the rep we wanted, but it’s only the beginning.

summary: Black Widow and Gamora's deaths bother me for two reasons. 1.   Many fans don't realize they ARE dead.   The version of Gamora...
body:
Black Widow and Gamora’s deaths bother me for two reasons.

1.   Many fans don’t realize they ARE dead.   The version of Gamora that is alive is from another timeline. That’s an alternate universe. Main continuity Gamora IS still dead.

2.   They are WORSE than dead.  Their souls are trapped forever.  Two heroes souls are trapped for all eternity… for doing the right thing.  Marvel is supposed to be the “Hopeful” company.   DC is giving us Shazam and Beebo (Legends of Tomorrow) and Rat / Roach shipping and surprisingly optimistic misfits who survive improbable odds, actual magick and supernatural creatures and Marvel has given us…  

Two heroes damned for eternity for doing the right thing…
It’s not fair, and it’s not right and it has no real purpose only to make them “worse than dead.”    The stone didn’t require this in the comics.  It was cruel and unnecessary and frankly I hate the idea that we’ve lost two of the most well loved female characters in the MCU.   “But we still have Captain Marvel!”  Um… Yay?
